declarations.comments: The type of an HTTP error, part of the handler type `ExceptT HTTPError m a`
declarations.title: HTTPError

modules.name: Nodetrout
modules.comments: This module exports Nodetrout's public API.

declarations.comments:
Creates a `node-http`-compatible request handler of type
`Request -> Response -> Effect Unit` which executes the specified routing
logic.
declarations.title: serve

declarations.comments:
A version of `serve` that can be used where handlers run in
`ExceptT HTTPError Aff`, i.e. the inner monad is already `Aff`.
declarations.title: serve'

modules.name: Nodetrout.Internal.Content
modules.comments: This module contains types and logic related to content negotiation.

declarations.comments:
Attempts to return the available content that best matches the client's
`Accept` header.
declarations.title: negotiate

modules.name: Nodetrout.Internal.Error
modules.comments: This module contains error-related types and logic.

declarations.comments: The type of an HTTP error, part of the handler type `ExceptT HTTPError m a`
declarations.title: HTTPError

declarations.comments:
Given two `HTTPError` values, determines the best response based on priority
or, when equal by priority, status code. The router assigns a lower priority
based on route specificity/depth so that the error presented to the client
is the one that is easier to resolve.
declarations.title: select

modules.name: Nodetrout.Internal.Request
modules.comments:
This module contains various request-processing functionality that would
otherwise clutter the `Router` module and increase its coupling to the Node
server (bad for testability).

declarations.comments:
A `Request` contains the request method, URL, and headers, as well as an
`Aff` that reads the request body, which are used in the routing logic.
Since this library is only interested in building a Node server, this
abstraction really only exists to help test routing logic.
declarations.title: Request

declarations.comments: Attempts to get the value from a request header.
declarations.title: headerValue

declarations.comments: Gets and parses the request method.
declarations.title: method

declarations.comments: Gets and parses the request path (URL).
declarations.title: path

declarations.comments:
Gets the first value from the query string matching the specified label
(key). For example, given a label of `foo` and a request with a query string
of `?foo=bar&foo=baz`, this would return a string `"bar"`.
declarations.title: queryParamValue

declarations.comments:
Gets all values from the query string matching the specified label (key).
For example, given a label of `foo` and a request with a query string of
`?foo=bar&foo=baz`, this would return an array `["bar", "baz"]`.
declarations.title: queryParamValues

declarations.comments:
Captures the remaining segments from the request path and returns them along
with a scoped request. Useful when routing the request.
declarations.title: removePath

declarations.comments: Gets the request body as a string.
declarations.title: stringBody

declarations.comments:
Gets the next segment from the request path if available and returns it
along with a scoped request. Useful when routing the request.
declarations.title: unconsPath

modules.name: Nodetrout.Internal.Router
modules.comments: This module contains the routing logic.

declarations.comments: Routes a request using the specified layout and handlers.
declarations.title: Router

modules.name: Nodetrout.Internal.Server.Node
modules.comments: This module contains the request handling logic related to `node-http`.

declarations.comments: Specifies how to write `content` to a response stream.
declarations.title: ResponseWritable

declarations.comments:
Creates a `node-http`-compatible request handler of type
`Request -> Response -> Effect Unit` which executes the specified routing
logic.
declarations.title: serve
